value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">5</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The oak tables are heavy and polished. The floor is</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">laid with rugs; cut glass 
            <choice>
              <sic>chand liers</sic>
              <corr>chandeliers</corr>
            </choice> hang down from the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">decorated plaster work of the 
            <choice>
              <sic>celing</sic>
              <corr>ceiling</corr>
            </choice>. 
            <choice>
              <sic>Kick kncaks</sic>
              <corr>Knick knacks</corr>
            </choice> have 
            <choice>
              <sic>survid</sic>
              <corr>survived</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">an inlaid work box, an old doublet; and the pear shaped</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">lute that the <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-eliz" key="Elizabeth I">Queen</rs> once played.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But 
            <choice>
              <sic>of</sic>
              <corr>if</corr>
            </choice> the great 
            <choice>
              <sic>Elizabethna</sic>
              <corr>Elizabethan</corr>
            </choice> house looks to us out of</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">proportion, a derelict among the bungalows, it is 
            <choice>
              <sic>b cause</sic>
              <corr>because</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the connection between it and the village is lost. If we</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">could see the great house as it was in <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-whar" key="Harrison, William">
            <choice>
              <sic> arriosn</sic>
              <corr>Harrison's'</corr>
            </choice></rs> time we</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">should see tracks raying out from the great house across the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">fields to the cottage, to the farm, even to the hovel.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Paths were worn by the fighters; and the ploughers.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">They must be armed against other men. They must</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">plough and sow together if they were not to starve in winter</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">This connection 
            <choice>
              <sic>isbetween</sic>
              <corr>between</corr>
            </choice> master and man is 
            <choice>
              <sic>pa nfully</sic>
              <corr>painfully</corr>
            </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>minutelt recoredc</sic>
              <corr>minutely recorded</corr>
            </choice> in the medieval letters. 
            <choice>
              <sic>I Its is</sic>
              <corr>It is</corr>
            </choice> the 
            <choice>
              <sic>stape</sic>
              <corr>staple</corr>
            </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of 
            <choice>
              <sic>th</sic>
              <corr>the</corr>
            </choice> whole correspondence between <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-past" key="Pastons">
              <choice>
                <sic>aston</sic>
                <corr>Paston</corr>
              </choice></rs> <add hand="typewriter" place="above">of <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-norf" key="Norfolk">Norfolk</rs></add> and the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-bets" key="Betsons">Betsons</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and the <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-payc" key="Paycockes">Paycockes</rs> of <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-esse" key="Essex">Essex</rs>. But there was also the other</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">less 
            <choice>
              <sic>visibl</sic>
              <corr>visible</corr>
            </choice> connection--the common belief. That</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">bond between the houses has been 
            <choice>
              <sic>gorwn</sic>
              <corr>grown</corr>
            </choice> over, 
            <choice>
              <sic>li e</sic>
              <corr>lies</corr>
            </choice> the track</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">along which the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations/xml#lit-cant" key="Canterbury Tales, The"/> rode to <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-cant" key="Canterbury">Canterbury</rs>.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Nobody rides there now. But when <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-rhol" key="Holinshed, Raphael">Holinshed</rs> made 
            <choice>
              <sic>is</sic>
              <corr>his</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-chro" key="Holinshed's Chronicles">chronicle</rs> that track led from house to house. It led to the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">village green; it led to the tree; to the 
            <choice>
              <sic>welll</sic>
              <corr>well</corr>
            </choice>. In the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">spring they danced round the maypole; in at midsummer they</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>llit</sic>
              <corr>lit</corr>
            </choice> the bon fire on the hill. At christmas the mummers</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">acted their dumb shows; and the boys came 
            <choice>
              <sic>wassiling</sic>
              <corr>wassailing</corr>
            </choice>.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The road led to the old Kings graces, to the stones</l>
